availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph N. Easley (Shelby County wagon maker)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, wagon maker. North Carolina native. Married Elizabeth Easley. Father of Hamilton Easley, John Easley, Mary Easley, William N. Easley, Juliet Easley, Carroll Easley, Emily Easley, Merrell Easley, David Easley, and Judith Easley. Wagon maker in Shelby County in 1850. Owned two enslaved people in Shelby County in 1850.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 2, p. 350 B; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 2; Find A Grave, "Joseph Easley, Jr (1805-1883)," Memorial #41192573, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41192573 (accessed November 8, 2017).
